content:
Diagnosis:
Prostate adenocarcinoma, clear cell type
Initial diagnosis January 2024
Stage T1c N0 M0
Gleason 3+4=7
PSA at diagnosis 4.2
BRCA1/2 wild type

Previous medical history:
Hypertension
Type 2 diabetes

Current medications:
Metformin 1g BD
Ramipril 5mg OD
Bicalutamide 150mg OD

Current situation:
Review following 3 months of hormone therapy

PSA now 0.8 (down from 4.2)

Tolerating treatment well with only grade 1 hot flushes

I reviewed [redacted name] today in follow up clinic. He continues on bicalutamide monotherapy which was started in January 2024. His PSA has shown an excellent response, dropping from 4.2 to 0.8. Treatment tolerance has been good with only mild hot flushes reported. He maintains good energy levels and has continued his regular swimming. Clinical examination today shows no concerning features. The plan is to continue current treatment and arrange PSA monitoring in 6 weeks through his GP. We will review him again in clinic in 3 months with repeat PSA.

status_updates.value: Early stage prostate cancer showing good biochemical response to hormone therapy with minimal side effects
PSA decreased from 4.2 to 0.8 after 3 months of bicalutamide
PSA monitoring in 6 weeks through GP
Review in clinic in 3 months with repeat PSA
